intro: Pavetta eketensis, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Pavetta eketensis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
